messages.text: (X-Post from <#C767M3VB3|academia>) I was suggested by <@U8JP5B9T2> to post this question here. Any insight? Thanks!

attachments.fallback: [January 4th, 2021 1:26 PM] jacobszelko: Hey is anyone here part of OHDSI (Observational Health Data Sciences and Informatics)? I see that there are no software packages built in Julia for the interface - I am trying to figure out if that is by choice or if there is simply a paucity of Julia programmers in this space. Thanks! :juliaheartpulse-dark:

Thanks! :juliaheartpulse-dark:

messages.text: Perhaps relevant :slack-zulip: topic: <https://julialang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/237221-biology-health-and-medicine/topic/DataKnots4FHIR>

elements.text: Perhaps relevant
topic:

messages.text: <@US64J0NPQ> Hi.  So, about 18 months ago we produced a prototype adapter to OHDSI using DataKnots (<https://querycombinators.org/dist/ohdsiknots-20190816.pdf>) with implementation <https://github.com/rbt-lang/SynPUF-HCFU>. We presented this at OHDSI's conference in 2019, <https://www.ohdsi.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/ohdsi-201909116.jpg> -- Anyway, this work is a lovely prototype, but not practical.  At this time, we're working on the SQL translation part of the challenge (<https://github.com/rbt-lang/DataKnots4Postgres.jl/tree/execute-shape>).  Probably this will be ~9 months before it's working, as we're making reasonable progress now.  Once that's done, we should be able to write OHDSI queries using DataKnots.

messages.text: <@US64J0NPQ> Anyway, if you have any particular requirements or timelines, let me know.  Sometimes it's more fun to build things when there are some practical constraints. I'm more often on Zulip.

messages.text: <@U7THT3TM3> do you know if it's possible to change my org-wide notification settings? Every few days I'm getting dozens of notifications for JuliaHealth packages. I've been going in and unwatching individual repos, but it seems like new ones are being created at a rapid clip, and I get subscribed to those notifications by default

elements.text: do you know if it's possible to change my org-wide notification settings? Every few days I'm getting dozens of notifications for JuliaHealth packages. I've been going in and unwatching individual repos, but it seems like new ones are being created at a rapid clip, and I get subscribed to those notifications by default

messages.text: Hmmm I wonder why you are getting subscribed by default...

elements.text: Hmmm I wonder why you are getting subscribed by default...

messages.text: You get subscribed to every new repo automatically?

elements.text: You get subscribed to every new repo automatically?

messages.text: Sure seems that way - I've never subscribed to any of the repos on purpose

elements.text: Sure seems that way - I've never subscribed to any of the repos on purpose

messages.text: Hmmm that is definitely bad

elements.text: Hmmm that is definitely bad

messages.text: Ah I think I know what it is

elements.text: Ah I think I know what it is

messages.text: I think it's a problem with how I had set up "teams" inside the organization

elements.text: I think it's a problem with how I had set up "teams" inside the organization

messages.text: This?

elements.text: This?

messages.text: I've just deleted all the teams - I think that should fix it

elements.text: I've just deleted all the teams - I think that should fix it

messages.text: That's in my main github settings

elements.text: That's in my main github settings

messages.text: You shouldn't need to change anything on your end, we should be able to fix it just in the JuliaHealth side

elements.text: You shouldn't need to change anything on your end, we should be able to fix it just in the JuliaHealth side

messages.text: Okay, let's do a test now. I'll create a new repo and let's see who gets auto-subscribed

elements.text: Okay, let's do a test now. I'll create a new repo and let's see who gets auto-subscribed

messages.text: :thumbsup:
Okay I think it worked: <https://github.com/JuliaHealth/brand-new-repo/watchers|https://github.com/JuliaHealth/brand-new-repo/watchers>

elements.text: Okay I think it worked:
https://github.com/JuliaHealth/brand-new-repo/watchers

messages.text: Hmm - yep, I'm not subscribed to that

elements.text: Hmm - yep, I'm not subscribed to that

messages.text: The problem was the teams. I just deleted all the teams and I think that fixed it.

elements.text: The problem was the teams. I just deleted all the teams and I think that fixed it.

messages.text: Awesome, thanks
